PL_SETTING.NAME: STRING_SEPARATORS
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies all separators that are used to separate a string.

PL_SETTING.NAME: MAX_SUBSTRING_LENGTH
PL_SETTING.DESC: S23 - This defines the maximum string length of substrings created through the String Separators Setting.

PL_SETTING.NAME: PREPEND_STRING
PL_SETTING.DESC: If this option is On, String Prepend occurs.The string prepend order is FileName;Resource ID;String Category.

PL_SETTING.NAME: NEWLINE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if \n should be replaced with NL\n.

PL_SETTING.NAME: START_DELIMITER
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the character that marks the beginning of a pesudotranslated string.

PL_SETTING.NAME: END_DELIMITER
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the character that marks the end of a pesudotranslated string.

PL_SETTING.NAME: EXTENSION_STRING
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the string to that is to extend the pseudotranslated string.

PL_SETTING.NAME: RELATIVE_STRING_ENLARGEMENT
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the growth of string length in percentage.A string grows by relative and absolute extension.

PL_SETTING.NAME: ABSOLUTE_STRING_ENLARGEMENT
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the growth of string length in characters.A string grows by relative and absolute extension.

PL_SETTING.NAME: HORIZONTAL_DIALOG_STRETCHING
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies the rate a dialog gets streched horizontally.

PL_SETTING.NAME: VERTICAL_DIALOG_STRETCHING
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies the rate a dialog gets streched vertically.

PL_SETTING.NAME: HOTKEY_HANDLING
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if hotkeys need to be pseudolocalized, and if so how they have to be pseudolocalized.

PL_SETTING.NAME: REPLACEMENT_METHOD
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the replacement method used for pseudotranslating characters.Matching means that similar looking characters can be used as replacement characters.

PL_SETTING.NAME: RANDOM_SCRIPT_SELECTION
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the scripts that are to be used with random replacement.

PL_SETTING.NAME: BIDI/DBCS_PREPEND
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the number of characters that are to be prepended using the scripts selected in the codepage setting.

PL_SETTING.NAME: RESOURCE_TYPE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if the selected resource type has to be pseudo localized.

PL_SETTING.NAME: MESSAGETABLE_LIMIT
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if pseudotranslated substrings in messagetables will be trimmed after 80 characters.

PL_SETTING.NAME: PREPEND_RESID
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if Resource ID should be prepended as part of the pseudo translation.

PL_SETTING.NAME: PREPEND_FILENAME
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if FileName should be prepended as part of the pseudo translation.

PL_SETTING.NAME: PREPEND_STRINGCATEGORY
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if String Category should be prepended as part of the pseudo translation.

PL_SETTING.NAME: DIALOG/HTML_FONTNAME
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the font that should be used in pseudolocalized dialogs.

PL_SETTING.NAME: DIALOG_FONTSIZE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the font size that should be used in pseudolocalized dialogs.

PL_SETTING.NAME: MAP_FILENAME
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the file that it is to be used as mappingtable.The mapping table will contain predefined translations for strings marked with the instruction Map or Map = String1,String2...

PL_SETTING.NAME: NONALPHABETIC
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option defines if a string not containing characters between a and z and A and Z will be localized.

PL_SETTING.NAME: ID_RANGE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the range of identifiers of strings that will not be localized.The IDs should be separated by .. .For ex. if resources between IDS 1000 and 1045 shouldnot be localized, specify 1000..1045

PL_SETTING.NAME: ID_PREFIX
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies a set of strings that can be used as start strings of identifiers of strings that should not be localized eg a string with identifier NOTLOC_Identifier should not be pseudo localized

PL_SETTING.NAME: MINIMUM_LENGTH
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the minimum length of strings that should be localized. The leading and trailing spaces are trimmed for this rule and they donot count in the string length.

PL_SETTING.NAME: NUMERIC
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option defines if strings containing numbers including floating numbers and negative numbers will be localized.

PL_SETTING.NAME: UPPERCASE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option defines if words only containing capital letters have to be localized, unless the string is OK. Note that FILE wouldnot be localized, but FILE: will.

PL_SETTING.NAME: FORMAT_SPECIFIER
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if words containing %, $, @ and _ should be localized

PL_SETTING.NAME: FILENAME
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if words containing a period (.) should be localized. Examples of such words are file names or variable names like File.Open

PL_SETTING.NAME: MIXEDCASE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if words containing both lower case letters as well as capitals should be localized. The first character of a word will be ignored. Examples of mixed-case words are IconVerticalSpacing and SystemExit.

PL_SETTING.NAME: WORD
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies if strings containing only one unlocalizable word should be localized.

PL_SETTING.NAME: LOCKSUBSTRING
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies sub strings that should not be localized

PL_SETTING.NAME: HTML
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies whether to use Loom to parse the HTML resource types for Pseudotranslation.

PL_SETTING.NAME: HTMLSubString
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting enables whether to treat each localizable HTML terms as substring.This setting works in conjuction with HTML Tag Rule.The HTML Tag Rule should be enabled to apply this option

PL_SETTING.NAME: ZeroLengthSubstring
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting enables whether to treat zero length localizable HTML tokens as substring.

PL_SETTING.NAME: ExcludeStartPlaceHolder
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the delimiters that will be used to exclude strings present within the delimiters from pseudo localization.
PL_SETTING.HELP: Use comma to separate the start and end delimiter, for example "[,]"

PL_SETTING.NAME: RuleSettingNames
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies all the settings to be treated as global constraints.

PL_SETTING.NAME: ConstraintDef
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies the precedence and ProgID (or CLSID) for all the constraints.

PL_SETTING.NAME: PLATFORM_MODE
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the mode in which PseudoLocalization can be operated.Generate-Generate the instructions.Pseudo Translate-PseudoTranslate the Source term.PseudoVerify-Verify the translated term against the generated instruction.The other items are combination of the above mentioned 3 choices.

PL_SETTING.NAME: RULES_INS_APPLICATION
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the application of manual instructions(other than the ones generated by Pseudo Localization) and system Rules. Instructions Only- Apply the User instructions as is. Rules only-Apply the System Rules and replace the User instruction with the generated instructions.Both Instructions and Rules-Merge the system generated instructions with the User instructions by applying both Rules and User instructions.

PL_SETTING.NAME: AppendGeneratedInstruction
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies the string to append to the generated instruction

PL_SETTING.NAME: StatusMessageMask
PL_SETTING.DESC: This setting specifies the message types to be enabled
PL_SETTING.HELP: VAL_LIST lists possible message types. Separate tag contains whether to enable 1 or disable 0 the message.

PL_SETTING.NAME: WordDelimiter
PL_SETTING.DESC: This option specifies the delimiters to break substring into words.
